text.snippet: drain within the pipe. Drain snake/auger: Another manual tool, this one is a flexible metal cable coiled inside a drum. Drain snakes are best for removing clogs located deeper in the drain system and work on toilets, kitchen and bath sinks, tubs, and showers. You simply place the metal fusilli/corkscrew- looking end of the cable in the pipe, then turn the drum to extend the

text.snippet: THE DRAIN SNAKE METHOD tap here to view video MATERIALS small bowl or bucket, rag, 1/8 hand auger (drain snake), utility knife 1  If you’ve not already removed the P-trap, follow steps 1–3. 2  With the trap off, place the end of the snake down the drain pipe. Bending the tip of the auger at a 45° angle helps get around the bend and elbows of the pipe. 3  Start with 1 foot (30.5cm) of the auger at

text.snippet: of  petroleum  jelly  around  the  lip  of  the  mbber  plunger.  The  wrong  tool.  Forget  about  using  an  expansion  nozzle  to  clear  a  clog  Although  it  is  supposed  to  unblock  drains  with  a  high-pressure  stream  of  water,  it  can  cause  a  leak  or  rupture  the  pipe. web.snippet: Oct 7, 2024 ... Place the end of the auger into the toilet bowl so it points down the drain. Turn the handle clockwise to extend the auger cable down the drain ...
